schema.title: Response Get Courses Api Courses  Get

post.description:
Create a new course with flexible association to the educational hierarchy.
    Courses can be associated with a Stream, Subject, Chapter, or Topic - or any combination of these.
    At least one hierarchy level must be specified.

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific course by its ID.

put.description:
Update an existing course. All fields are optional.
    The course's position in the educational hierarchy can be modified by updating
    stream_id, subject_id, chapter_id, or topic_id.

delete.description: Delete a specific course. Only the creator of the course can delete it.

get.description: Get a subject by ID

put.description:
Update a subject

All fields are optional:
- name: String (1-100 characters)
- description: String (max 500 characters)
- code: String (2-20 characters, uppercase letters and numbers only)
- credits: Integer
- stream_id: Integer (ID of the stream this subject belongs to)

This endpoint requires teacher or admin privileges.

schema.description: Fields to update. Note: uses stream_id, not class_id
schema.title: Subject Update

Delete a subject

This endpoint requires teacher or admin privileges.

schema.title: Response Get Subjects Api Subjects  Get

post.description:
Create a new subject

Required fields:
- name: String (1-100 characters)
- code: String (2-20 characters, uppercase letters and numbers only)
- stream_id: Integer (ID of the stream this subject belongs to)

Optional fields:
- description: String (max 500 characters)
- credits: Integer (default: 0)

Query parameters:
- auto_generate_code: If true, will generate a unique code if the provided one exists

This endpoint requires teacher or admin privileges.

parameters.name: auto_generate_code

schema.description: Automatically generate a unique code if the provided one exists
schema.title: Auto Generate Code

parameters.description: Automatically generate a unique code if the provided one exists

schema.description: Subject data. Note: requires stream_id, not class_id. Code must be unique.

examples.name: Physics
examples.description: Study of matter, energy, and the interaction between them

schema.title: Response Read Questions Api Questions  Get
Response Read Questions By Course Api Questions Course  Course Id  Get

Response Read Questions By Chapter Api Questions Chapter  Chapter Id  Get
Response Read Questions By Topic Api Questions Topic  Topic Id  Get
Response Read Questions By Difficulty Api Questions Difficulty  Difficulty Level  Get
Response Read Answers Api Questions  Question Id  Answers Get

post.description:
Upload an image for a question and return the public URL.
The URL can then be used when creating or updating a question.

Create a question with an optional image upload.
This endpoint handles both the question data and image upload in a single request.

Note: Answers must be added separately after creating the question.

put.description:
Update a question with an optional image upload.
This endpoint handles both the question data and image upload in a single request.

post.description:
Create a complete question with answers, supporting image uploads for both the question and answers.

This endpoint handles:
- Question content and metadata
- Optional question image
- Multiple answers with their content and correctness
- Optional images for each answer (can have one image per answer option)

schema.title: Response Read Exams Api Exams Exams  Get

post.description:
Create a new exam with the following features:

- Basic exam information (title, description, dates, duration, max marks, max questions)
- Educational hierarchy linking (course, class, subject, chapter, topic)

All ID fields (course_id, class_id, etc.) are optional, but if provided they must exist in the database.
Use 0 or null for fields you don't want to set.

Example payload:
```json
{
  "title": "Maths Final Test",
  "description": "Final assessment for Algebra",
  "start_datetime": "2025-05-03T10:00:00",
  "end_datetime": "2025-05-03T11:00:00",
  "duration_minutes": 60,
  "max_marks": 100,
  "max_questions": 20,
  "course_id": 1,
  "class_id": 2,
  "subject_id": 3,
  "chapter_id": 4,
  "topic_id": 5
}
```

schema.title: Response Read User Exams Api Exams Exams My Exams Get

put.description:
Update an existing exam.

You can update any combination of fields, as only the provided fields will be changed.
For ID fields (course_id, class_id, etc.), use 0 or null for fields you want to clear.

Example payload:
```json
{
  "title": "Updated Exam Title",
  "description": "Updated Description",
  "course_id": 2,
  "class_id": 0,
  "max_marks": 120,
  "max_questions": 25
}
```

post.description:
Create a new stream in the system.
    
    Required Parameters:
    - name: String (3-100 characters)
    - class_id: Integer (ID of the class this stream belongs to)
    
    Optional Parameters:
    - description: String (max 500 characters)
    
    This endpoint requires admin privileges.

Create a new mapping between a subscription plan and a package.

This allows defining which packages are unlocked by each subscription plan.
Admin privileges required.

Stream.description:
Schema for stream response.
Includes all fields from StreamBase plus:
- id: integer
- created_at: datetime
- updated_at: datetime (optional)
- class_: class details (optional)
